title: China's loss of economic independence to Europe

content.prompt: Which of the following most accurately describes the interactions between China and Europe in the nineteenth century?

choices.label: China became isolated politically in part because of its suppression of pro-Western Chinese dissidents.
China effectively lost its economic independence to Europe as a result of military losses to European forces.
China became a major exporter of manufactured goods to Europe.
China and Europe were forced into an uneasy alliance to reverse Japanese imperial expansion in northern China.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
